snippet: The Freiburg Baroque Orchestra’s concert on Tuesday night at Alice Tully Hall featured a varied approach to ornamentation, as it did in its most recent release, a disc of Bach’s four orchestral suites.
abstract: Allan Kozinn reviews performance by the Freiburg Baroque Orchestra at Alice Tully Hall. (M)
lead_paragraph: Alice Tully Hall The Freiburg Baroque Orchestra has performed impressively at the Mostly Mozart Festival in recent years and has built an estimable discography. Its most recent release is a rewarding traversal of Bach's four orchestral suites (on Harmonia Mundi), and on Tuesday evening the ensemble brought its zesty, sharply etched interpretations of these works to Alice Tully Hall.
